critique: The executive order describes the circumstances of several women who are being appointed to positions in the Bureau of Engraving and Printing. The order focuses on the hardships faced by these women and their families due to the death or disability of their husbands or fathers who were plate printers. The order aims to evoke feelings of joy that these women are being helped, and sadness and sympathy for the women and their families. There is no indication of anger, fear, disgust, or surprise.
